20101209000030.333|20101209000032.000|CCO|VERGE OF WINNING THE FINAL VOTES

20101209000033.667|20101209000035.333|CCO|CHANGE.

20101209000037.000|20101209000038.667|CCO|IMPORTANT SECURITY CHALLENGES.
20101209000038.667|20101209000040.333|CCO|ONE INVOLVED CYBERATTACKS ON THE
20101209000040.333|20101209000042.000|CCO|CORPORATE WEBSITES OF VISA AND 
20101209000042.000|20101209000043.667|CCO|MASTERCARD AND SUPPORTERS OF 
20101209000043.667|20101209000045.333|CCO|WIKILEAKS WEBSITE ARE TAKING 
20101209000045.333|20101209000047.000|CCO|CREDIT.
20101209000047.000|20101209000048.667|CCO|THEY SAY IT'S PAY BACK BECAUSE 
20101209000048.667|20101209000050.333|CCO|BOTH VISA AND MASTER CARD 
20101209000050.333|20101209000052.000|CCO|STOPPED TAKING PAYMENTS ON THE 
20101209000052.000|20101209000053.429|CCO|WIKI LIKE SITE AFTER IT RELEASED
20101209000053.429|20101209000054.857|CCO|THOUSANDS OF MILITARY DOCUMENTS.
20101209000054.857|20101209000056.286|CCO|IS YOUR CREDIT AT RISK OR YOUR 
20101209000056.286|20101209000057.714|CCO|PRIVACY?
20101209000057.714|20101209000059.143|CCO|JOE JOHNS.
20101209000059.143|20101209000100.571|CCO|>> SUPPORTERS OF WIKILEAKS 
20101209000100.571|20101209000102.000|CCO|ORGANIZATION AND ITS FOUNDER 
20101209000102.000|20101209000104.000|CCO|JULIAN ASSANGE ARE SUSPECTED OF 
20101209000104.000|20101209000106.000|CCO|LAUNCHING ATTACKING ON A NUMBER 
20101209000106.000|20101209000108.000|CCO|OF TARGETS INCLUDING 
20101209000108.000|20101209000110.000|CCO|MASTERCARD.COM AND VISA.COM.
20101209000110.000|20101209000112.000|CCO|THE MOTIVE IS RETALIATION 
20101209000112.000|20101209000113.667|CCO|BECAUSE THE ATTACKS SEEM TO BE 
20101209000113.667|20101209000115.333|CCO|DIRECTED AGAINST COMPANIES THAT 
20101209000115.333|20101209000117.000|CCO|TOOK ACTION AGAINST WIKILEAKS 
20101209000117.000|20101209000118.667|CCO|AFTER ITS RELEASE OF SENSITIVE 
20101209000118.667|20101209000120.333|CCO|AMERICAN DOCUMENTS.
20101209000120.333|20101209000122.000|CCO|THESE ARE BEING REFERRED TO AS 
20101209000122.000|20101209000123.429|CCO|DISTRIBUTED DENIAL OF SERVICE 
20101209000123.429|20101209000124.857|CCO|ATTACKS.
20101209000124.857|20101209000126.286|CCO|BASICALLY, A BUNCH OF COMPUTERS 
20101209000126.286|20101209000127.714|CCO|ACCESSING A WEBSITE ALL AT ONCE 
20101209000127.714|20101209000129.143|CCO|WITH REQUEST FOR SERVICE.
20101209000129.143|20101209000130.571|CCO|ON A TWITTER PAGE IDENTIFIED AS 
20101209000130.571|20101209000132.000|CCO|OPERATION PAYBACK, ACTIVISTS, 
20101209000132.000|20101209000133.667|CCO|NUMBERS UNKNOWN, WROTE ABOUT 
20101209000133.667|20101209000135.333|CCO|GETTING UNSPECIFIED WEAPONS 
20101209000135.333|20101209000137.000|CCO|READY AND NOW HERE WE ARE.
20101209000137.000|20101209000138.667|CCO|A STATEMENT WAS ISSUED BY VISA 
20101209000138.667|20101209000140.333|CCO|SAYING, VISA'S PROCESSING 
20101209000140.333|20101209000142.000|CCO|NETWORK, WHICH HANDLES 
20101209000142.000|20101209000143.667|CCO|CARDHOLDER TRANSACTION, IS 
20101209000143.667|20101209000145.333|CCO|FUNCTIONING NORMALLY AND 
20101209000145.333|20101209000147.000|CCO|CARDHOLDERS CAN CONTINUE TO USE 
20101209000147.000|20101209000148.667|CCO|CARDS AS THEY ROUTINELY WOULD.
20101209000148.667|20101209000150.333|CCO|ACCOUNT DATA NOT AT RISK.
20101209000150.333|20101209000152.000|CCO|VISA SEPARATELY SAID ITS 
20101209000152.000|20101209000153.667|CCO|CORPORATE WEBSITE, VISA.COM, IS 
20101209000153.667|20101209000155.333|CCO|EXPERIENCING HEAVIER THAN NORMAL
20101209000155.333|20101209000157.000|CCO|TRAFFIC.
